member.name: T:QueryBuilderControl.DefinitionQueryDockPane_ShowButton

member.name: T:QueryBuilderControl.Module1
member.summary: This sample provides an illustration of how to use the QueryBuilderControl. This add-in contains a dockPane which hosts the QueryBuilderControl. The dockPane is used to view and modify the definition query for feature layers and standalone tables. Use the Expression property to determine the current and complete SQL expression.
member.remarks: 1. In Visual Studio click the Build menu. Then select Build Solution. 1. Click Start button to open ArcGIS Pro. 1. ArcGIS Pro will open. 1. Open an existing project. 1. Click on the ADD-IN TAB. 1. Click on the *Show DefinitionQueryDockPane* button. 1. The Definition Query dock pane will open up. ![UI](Screenshots/QueryBuilderDockPane.png) 1. Select a feature layer or standalone table in the TOC. The dock pane will display the definition query for the highlighted TOC item. 1. Use the query builder control to update the definition query for the highlighted TOC item. 1. Use the Apply button to write the updated definition query to the highlighted layer. ![UI](Screenshots/QueryBuilderDockPane_Layer.png)

member.name: P:QueryBuilderControl.Module1.Current

member.name: M:QueryBuilderControl.Module1.CanUnload
member.summary: Called by Framework when ArcGIS Pro is closing
member.returns: False to prevent Pro from closing, otherwise True
